column1: 4.4.4.4.1	 Summary of evidence and recommendations for underactive bladder
Evaluation of LUTS by history and examination alone is insufficient to accurately diagnose female BOO.
Urine flow studies cannot accurately diagnose BOO in women.
Ultrasound scanning is unable to accurately diagnose BOO in women.

Electromyography alone is unable to accurately diagnose BOO in women, although it may be of use in 
combination with pressureâ€“flow studies and in differentiation of anatomical vs. functional BOO.
